Name: Sofia City
Description: The capital city of Bulgaria, Sofia, is known for its historical landmarks, vibrant culture, and as the political, economic, and cultural center of the country.

Name: Plovdiv
Description: Plovdiv is one of the oldest cities in Europe, known for its well-preserved Roman theater, vibrant cultural scene, and historical significance.

Name: Varna
Description: Varna is a major port city located on the Black Sea, known for its beaches, resorts, and historical attractions, as well as being a center for maritime industry and culture.

Name: Burgas
Description: Burgas is a major port city on the Black Sea, known for its beaches, natural parks, and as an important center for trade and tourism.

Name: Ruse
Description: Ruse is a city located on the Danube River, known for its classical architecture, proximity to Romania, and its role in Bulgarian industry and trade.

Name: Stara Zagora
Description: Stara Zagora is an ancient city with a rich history, known for its well-preserved Roman ruins and as a center for industry and culture in southern Bulgaria.

Name: Pleven
Description: Pleven is a city known for its historical significance, particularly the Battle of Pleven, and its role in agriculture and industry in northern Bulgaria.

Name: Sliven
Description: Sliven is a city in southeastern Bulgaria, known for its textile industry, natural beauty, and as the birthplace of Bulgaria s national hero Hristo Botev.
